title: Rruchi man
author: Rruchi man
content: These days, networking has been made easier with social media, where you can easily make a referral, and people on your contact list take it seriously based on the level of trust and reliability that they have for you.If you make a referral and people who follow it are satisfied, their level of confidence and trust in you increases, and they value you more.There is a need to be careful about the referrals you make, because some referrals are capable of ruining your image and the trust that people will have in you.I have seen people question why bitcoin is still the first choice that is referred to new people in cryptocurrency who want to invest, and one reason for that is that bitcoin can be relied on when compared to other cryptocurrencies, especially the new ones, and you don't want to gamble with your referrals.I know we always have to advise people to do their own research for any referral given to them, but still, you do not want to give someone a referral on some altcoin just for them to do their own research and find out that they just dodged a bullet.Do not just refer to any cryptocurrency; refer to bitcoin when introducing a newbie to cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: When I First saw the thread title, my mind went straight to my experience with referral programmes where most many of them truned out to be negative and indeed this have effected my trust for those individuals who referred me to such a service, and since then I disliked anything referral and if I want to subscribe to any thing and it requires me to referred someone, I automatically have a negative feelings for such project's regardless of it importance to me at that moment.I can still referr someone to bitcoin and still be comfortable doing so because I know what bitcoin stands for and it ability to perform even better at anytime, but same can not be said of other coins or projects because their existence can't be guaranteed on the long term base, bitcoin is not a crowd funding scheme so I don't need to be under a mandate to refere anyone, but if the person build interest in bitcoin, why not, I can conformably educate them on how best to secure their investment in bitcoin, but aside from bitcoin, I can't do same with any other coin.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Even if you suggest your friends, relatives, or random person to buy Bitcoin. You don't know what's on their mind. When they've bought and then BTC suddenly plummeted, you will take the blame from them. This has surely happened to many of us here and that's why even suggesting or referring people to buy Bitcoin, always put a disclaimer that it is highly volatile and you have no control over the market and its price. Because they might have that first glance and thought that you've just referred them and you earned money from them and then, the price goes down so as their losses. So, if you're going to tell someone to buy Bitcoin personally, make sure that they have understood every basics about it. This is why it is important to know what we are investing to pass that logic to them.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: When it comes to referring something useful, always go on known and reputable service,, where most users in the space have experience of using them and you can't go wrong with that. Of course, i only refer those things i personally experienced so i can give thoughts about it, also compiling negative reviews will give more results if you should go or not using them. This is because i don't want these users be frustrated with me if they don't experience good enough on that service. For something investments, i don'f refer other coins than those major coins like BTC, ETH, BNB, etc. other than will be too risky especially those meme coins where price are based on mere hype .

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Life has taught me that people do not usually like to share how they make money with others. This is not just my opinion but also common knowledge that people do not typically do things for free, there is always a catch. That’s why newbies are skeptical when they are being introduced to Bitcoin by certain people. They often ask what’s in it for you if I invest in bitcoin. They assume you are earning a percentage of their investment as is common with most referral programs. You can educate people about bitcoin but never try to coerce them into investing in Bitcoin. Even though bitcoin investment is a good thing, your persistence may come across as suspicious and cause them to be wary of Bitcoin.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Well, I don't invite those who don't know much about Bitcoin and Bitcoin is the first thing that I introduce to my friends or family and before I refer them to other cryptos I first tell them that there's no 100% guarantee that they could receive airdrop by tapping or referring someone because some of them just created for marketing purposes and no real tokens. You should only refer someone that you know believes you because if you refer someone that is new to crypto they might think that we are promoting a scam company but they don't exactly what is bitcoin or the crypto you are referring to. That is why I only have a few friends who know about crypto many of them are not interested in crypto they always think a networking is scam.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: I have yet to see somebody sending me a Referral link with out having sort of malicious intents.By that I mean being subject of a Referral with out having to suffer particular consequences such as having to spend Money so the Referee gets their Bonus.  Particularly if most of the Referrals end up spending their Money once only to never use the Service again.  Pretty much all the Referral Links I ever received worked exactly like this.  Lure somebody in, have them spend Money unnecessarily, repeat.  For the Referred person to not end up being in a loss, they need to do the same and lure others in.Sort of a Pyramid Scheme if you ask me.So yes, even if the Service I receive a link for is 100 percent legitimate and real with a real base of Customers, any Referral link is sketchy to me.  More over, it is very bad from a Privacy perspective to use Referral links.  A chain that looks like a spider web is resulted, which can then be used to create all sorts of Analytics with out your consent.  It makes that link you click so much more valuable at the end of the day.Everybody is a product in such schemes.  They use and sell information nonchalantly.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: I prefer not to invite anyone to invest in Bitcoin or cryptocurrency to avoid unnecessary trouble. most times people who promote cryptocurrency are those that are likely to scam others. When people hear about cryptocurrency, the first thing that comes to their mind is Bitcoin, although they may not fully understand it, but many people dream of owning Bitcoins, and that's where we come in, giving them a brief about Bitcoin investment.  When explaining Bitcoin to others, it would be useful to share both the benefits and risks, so they're not surprised when the market dips and their investment decreases. I've seen cases where people blame others for their investment losses because they didn't understand the market. To avoid trouble, I don't refer people to Bitcoin investment,  instead, I educate them about it, and they can decide for themselves whether to invest. It's their personal choice.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on August 03, 2024, 10:01:36 PMThese days, networking has been made easier with social media, where you can easily make a referral, and people on your contact list take it seriously based on the level of trust and reliability that they have for you.First of all, when you want to become an influencer, you need to consider moral principles. Think about it by yourself, and think of positive as well as negative effects you can bring to your followers.By that deep consideration, you will have to think more carefully before you shill any project, in any program such as a referral program. Because it's simple if what you share brings benefit to others but it's not easy if your sharing causes negative effects to your followers. You can not say you're not responsible for your activities.At the end, it's up to each person to decide doing or not doing something but as an influencer, you have your responsibility too and it's undeniable.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: The problem with having to refer people is in the understanding of the mindset of those to whom, you hope to refer. I hardly see any of these ads and influencers talking about the downside to an investment or a commodity while doing adverts.Having to refer people isn’t always based on incentivized adverts but, a lot of times, people just focus on success stories and hid the downside to the entire process. I think this is vital for proper evaluation of prospects by potential investors. You throw the ball in there court and depending on how they choose, you would be relaxed from being reprimanded by the public.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.right85 on August 04, 2024, 03:13:41 AMThe problem with having to refer people is in the understanding of the mindset of those to whom, you hope to refer. I hardly see any of these ads and influencers talking about the downside to an investment or a commodity while doing adverts.When people do referral job, they will try to expose it to as many people as they can. More exposure to more people, more opportunities to get referral income that is most concerning interest of influencers.To attract people and gain referral income, they often say about good things and try to hide bad things that can affect their chance to get referral income successfully. It's not right way to hide possible negative things to newbies and kindful, frank and moral influencers will apply this method. Newbies who want to seek advice from influencers, must do their own research, and know about a big rule "Don't trust, verify".

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: It depends on the goal.If someone is looking to grow their social medias and get as much as they can without take care of their followers, they will fake it and always convincing other people to escape the matrix by investing in Bitcoin. Some people will try to ruin our reputation, that's the risk of becoming a content creator, it's either they will eat you or you eat them first.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on August 03, 2024, 10:01:36 PMDo not just refer to any cryptocurrency; refer to bitcoin when introducing a newbie to cryptocurrency.I just commented on a post about telegram games and it's impact on bitcoin investment for people. And I've stumbled on this your post which I feel we can draw some parallel to. In this time when these telegram games are trending and people are looking for how to get money quick in cryptocurrency aside Bitcoin, the players of these games would rather refer their friends to sign up on these games to play and earn from cryptocurrency that is not Bitcoin other than Bitcoin. While these is happening is because it is "easy" for them to make money on these games than investing in Bitcoin and making money from it. However , in my own estimation referring someone to Bitcoin is easier when that individual has a skill that can be used to generate more Bitcoins should the person asks how can he earn more Bitcoin. So if the person has a skill you can simply tell the person that they can offer their and ask for payments in Bitcoin.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Rruchi man on August 03, 2024, 10:01:36 PMI know we always have to advise people to do their own research for any referral given to them, but still, you do not want to give someone a referral on some altcoin just for them to do their own research and find out that they just dodged a bullet.We are in the days when people are so impatient and ignorant. If you tell them about the Bitcoin cycle, they will simply tell you that they want to invest in a coin that will give them quick profit. Investing in altcoins needs a whole lot of research and the ability to take risks. I can give someone a lesson about investing in both Bitcoin and altcoins; it is now the responsibility of such an individual to make his choice.QuoteDo not just refer to any cryptocurrency; refer to bitcoin when introducing a newbie to cryptocurrency.I will always refer people to Bitcoin since it has shown over the years, that it is reliable and profitable. It has been attacked by many forces, yet it remains strong. I also have the confidence that it will last for many years ahead. With this in mind, I can comfortably recommend Bitcoin to investors. I don't have much knowledge about altcoins so I won't recommend anyone. Meanwhile, investing in Bitcoin is easy, and newbies can easily learn about it within a short period.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: That is why we must be careful when we want to share to our friends in social media and make sure that the program is good and not a scam program. We must research for more to finds if that program can gives as their promise to their members so we don't lose trust from our friends. When we see some advertisement from our friends, we must research for more about the program and not just join without asking to our friend because we want to avoids the scams.I only explain to my friends about cryptocurrency, about bitcoin and altcoin, and not trying to force them to decide to follow my explanation. That will be up to them to decide because they must know about responsibility which I always bold it in investing in cryptocurrency/Bitcoin. I don't want they lose their money because of my explanation so I always tells them to research for more after I explain.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on August 04, 2024, 12:55:09 AMI prefer not to invite anyone to invest in Bitcoin or cryptocurrency to avoid unnecessary trouble. most times people who promote cryptocurrency are those that are likely to scam others. When people hear about cryptocurrency, the first thing that comes to their mind is Bitcoin, although they may not fully understand it, but many people dream of owning Bitcoins, and that's where we come in, giving them a brief about Bitcoin investment.  When explaining Bitcoin to others, it would be useful to share both the benefits and risks, so they're not surprised when the market dips and their investment decreases. I've seen cases where people blame others for their investment losses because they didn't understand the market. To avoid trouble, I don't refer people to Bitcoin investment,  instead, I educate them about it, and they can decide for themselves whether to invest. It's their personal choice.I completely agree with you and that's what I'm doing too. I don't introduce and talk about bitcoin to anyone, but if someone proactively asks me, I will not refuse, but what I will provide them is basic information and documents about bitcoin. I will refuse to answer immediately if he mentions asking me whether I should invest or not, or give him advice. Furthermore, I like to mention and emphasize the risks and losses they will encounter instead of talking too much about profits. In my opinion, giving investment advice to others is like getting yourself into trouble, so instead give them the knowledge and let them make their own decisions.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Once I get a referral for anything from the internet or social media, I don't just dive into it until I have done my own research about the risks involved. Some people don't care about the risk they are putting others at when they refer them to any investment that will put liquidate their capital. What they are only concerned with is the profit they can get. I always advise newbies to ask questions and do research about whatever investment idea they get from online; that's the best way to avoid wasting their capital on assets that are not worth investing in.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Firstly I don't recommend anybody referring someone especially a newbie into the crypto space or Bitcoin rather. There is a huge difference between putting someone through in understanding bitcoin and refering them to bitcoin. If you observe closely you will notice that newbies are the ones that fall the most for things like hacks and scams simply because they are poorly orientated about the security of their funds as well as privacy which in fact is supposed to be the first thing a newbie should be made aware of.The biggest downside to refering a newbie to Bitcoin is not dip rather it's the risk of losing funds that they are face with. It's better a newbie show a learning interest in bitcoin then you proceed to giving him privacy and security awareness, than telling them the can make more money by buying bitcoin.Of what use are the coins if you can't protect them ?

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: People like us that cherish our privacy have little to no interest in referral programs especially those that do not privacy a priority. Apart from this, there is a huge burden attached to referring someone that becomes a victim of any attack, this is why referrals is not fashionable to me. Finally, now that referral programs have become an integral part of MLM, many companies are going that direction and as expected, people with evil plans are not left behind. Therefore, we must be careful not to fall victim of phishing and other forms of hack and data breach that comes with clicking the wrong link or installing the wrong application.

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: Sincerely the title of the thread sounds misleading. Anyways, I find it very hard to ever communicate altcoins to people especially people who are new to crypto space as I feel a guit of misleading them one way or the other so I focus on bitcoin but that's only when they already have a background knowledge of what bitcoin is and really wants it then as one who has been educated a bit on BTC I can share with them some necessary and important stuffs about bitcoin including the does and don'ts, the dips and how risky it could be if taken on a short term target. It's true that sometimes we might be thinking we are doing the best for people yet it ends up falling into our hands as victims of blames from wrong decisions taken but at the same time we ought to do them in a careful and serene way, so before one can mention altcoins to people you must make sure they are well acquainted with some level of knowledge because scam is real and they are looking for preys who are new to the space hence referrals showed be done consciously.
